Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford launched a Statcast-projected 407-foot walk-off grand slam to stun New York and secure a 7-4 victory for the Rangers.
Post-Match Reflections: Langford expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Manager Bruce Bochy highlighted Langford's poise and ability to perform in clutch situations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first walk-off grand slam for the Rangers, including the postseason, since Nelson Cruz in Game 2 of the 2011 ALCS.
The Rangers have now won via walk-off in three straight wins and six of their last seven home victories.
